attributes.additional_details: The mini-budget benefits the higher earners in the population and not the lower-income people who need support and help most, especially those faced with the terrifying cost of living crisis and, in particular, those trying to keep a roof over their family’s heads.  This is morally and financially wrong.
attributes.background: Bring back the 45% tax rate, paid by 629,000 people and rising. While it might not be a substantial sum of money in total terms, it’s the right decision and the right message.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623752

The 45% rate has not yet been abolished, and the Chancellor of the Exchequer has now announced that this tax will not be removed: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-63114279
